ML_AA_NAMES.AA_NAME: London Borough of Richmond upon Thames

ADDRESS_CONTRACTING_BODY.OFFICIALNAME: London Borough of Richmond upon Thames

TITLE.P: AfC is intending to commission external Short Breaks activities for disabled children

SHORT_DESCR.P: AfC is intending to commission the following external Short Breaks programmes for 33 months from July 2018 until 31.3.2021, with an option to extend for a further period of 24 months to a maximum term of 57 months.
Lot 1: After School Clubs (SLD) and (MLD) RBK and LBR;
Lot 2: Buddy Project RBK and LBR;
Lot 3: Holiday Clubs (SLD) and (MLD) RBK and LBR;
Lot 4: Weekend Clubs RBK and LBR;
Lot 5: Youth Club RBK and LBR
We are seeking to Commission similar programmes to be delivered across both Kingston and Richmond in distinct venues in each borough.

TITLE.P: Short Break After School Clubs in Richmond and Kingston

MAIN_SITE.P: Merton, Kingston upon Thames and Sutton, Hounslow and Richmond upon Thames.

SHORT_DESCR.P: Integrated Services for Disabled Children, as part of Achieving for Children are undertaking an open tendering process in order to procure services for disabled children, young people and their families. Commissioned organisations work in partnership with Achieving for Children to deliver excellent services for children and their families:
— short Break activities for disabled children and young people after school during term time,
— a range of specialist after school activities for children and young people who have moderate or severe learning disabilities,

— the programme will include sessions based at the provider’s venue such as art and crafts, music, drama, singing, cooking etc as well as activities in the community such as swimming, cinema, bowling, playground etc.

OPTIONS_DESCR.P: AfC proposes to enter into one contract for each Lot for an initial period of thirty-three (33) months with the successful Tenderers (Service Providers). AfC may extend the contracts for a further period of twenty-four (24) months. The estimated value published in this notice is in respect of the entire contract period (including the option extension) of 57 months.

TITLE.P: Short Breaks Buddy Project in Richmond and Kingston

MAIN_SITE.P: Merton, Kingston upon Thames and Sutton,Hounslow and Richmond upon Thames.

SHORT_DESCR.P: Integrated Services for Disabled Children, as part of Achieving for Children are undertaking an open tendering process in order to procure services for disabled children, young people and their families. Commissioned organisations work in partnership with Achieving for Children to deliver excellent services for children and their families.
The Buddy Project will:
— ensure all referred young people are matched with a volunteer buddy,
— each session with the young person and the buddy will last a minimum of 2 hours,
— arrange sessions that will take place in the community, accessing a chosen activity by the young person,
— support young people to gain independence, increase their confidence through accessing mainstream activities in their community.

OPTIONS_DESCR.P: AfC proposes to enter into one contract for each Lot for an initial period of thirty-three (33) months with the successful Tenderers (Service Providers). AfC may extend the contracts for a further period of twenty-four (24) months. The estimated value published in this notice is in respect of the entire contract period (including the option extension) of 57 months.

TITLE.P: Short Breaks Holiday Clubs in Richmond and Kingston

MAIN_SITE.P: Merton, Kingston upon Thames and Sutton, Hounslow and Richmond upon Thames.

SHORT_DESCR.P: Integrated Services for Disabled Children, as part of Achieving for Children are undertaking an open tendering process in order to procure services for disabled children, young people and their families. Commissioned organisations work in partnership with Achieving for Children to deliver excellent services for children and their families.
The Holiday Clubs will:
— provide a variety of fun activities aimed at children and young people aged between 8-18 years,
— run activities from accessible venues but mostly the activities will be community based,
— provide a safe place for children and young people to socialise and learn new skills,
— consult with the children and young people to ensure the programme of activities are flexible and based on their ideas, needs and interests,
— learn communication skills, focusing on Makaton signs, using Pec’s, where relevant, and social development,
— have experienced workers who will support the children and young people to achieve their goals and gain outcomes,
— all Short Break activities should also seek to develop social skills and friendship groups as a priority,
— all interventions for children with special needs should have a focus on developing social skills.

OPTIONS_DESCR.P: AfC proposes to enter into one contract for each Lot for an initial period of thirty-three (33) months with the successful Tenderers (Service Providers). AfC may extend the contracts for a further period of twenty-four (24) months. The estimated value provided in this notice is in respect of the total maximum contract period of 57 months.

TITLE.P: Short Breaks Weekend Clubs in Richmond and Kingston

MAIN_SITE.P: Merton, Kingston upon Thames and Sutton, Hounslow and Richmond upon Thames.

SHORT_DESCR.P: Integrated Services for Disabled Children, as part of Achieving for Children are undertaking an open tendering process in order to procure services for disabled children, young people and their families. Commissioned organisations work in partnership with Achieving for Children to deliver excellent services for children and their families.
The Weekend Clubs will:
— provide a variety of fun activities aimed at children and young people aged between 9-18 years,
— provide a safe place for children and young people to socialise, learn new skills,
— support children and young people to gain independence and increase their confidence,
— consult with the children and young people to ensure the programme of activities are flexible and based on their ideas, needs and interests and include some community activities,
— learn communication skills, focusing on Makaton signs, using Pec’s, where relevant, and social development,
— have experienced workers who will support the children and young people to achieve their goals and gain outcomes.

OPTIONS_DESCR.P: AfC is intending to commission external Short Breaks programmes for 33 months from July 2018 until 31.3.2021, with an option to extend for a further period of 24 months to a maximum term of 57 months. The estimated value of this Lot stated in this notice is in respect of the maximum total contract period of 57 months.

TITLE.P: Short Breaks Youth Clubs for disabled children in Kingston and Richmond

MAIN_SITE.P: Merton, Kingston upon Thames and Sutton, Hounslow and Richmond upon Thames.

SHORT_DESCR.P: Integrated Services for Disabled Children, as part of Achieving for Children are undertaking an open tendering process in order to procure services for disabled children, young people and their families. Commissioned organisations work in partnership with Achieving for Children to deliver excellent services for children and their families.
The Youth Club will:
— be aimed at young people aged between 14-18 years,
— enable young people to gain independence and increase their confidence,
— be a fun place for young people to socialise and learn new skills,
— develop the youth club programme with young people based on their ideas, needs and interests,
— learn communication skills, focusing on Makaton signs, using Pec’s, where relevant, and social development,
— have experienced workers who will support the children and young people to achieve their goals and gain outcomes.

OPTIONS_DESCR.P: AfC is intending to commission external Short Breaks programmes for 33 months from July 2018 until 31.3.2021, with an option to extend for a further period of 24 months to a maximum term of 57 months. The estimated values for this lot specified in this notice is the total value for the maximum period of contract (including the option period) of 57 months.

INFO_ADD.P: The contracting authority considers that this contract may be suitable for economic operators that are small or medium enterprises (SMEs). However, any selection of tenderers will be based solely on the criteria set out for the procurement.
For more information about this opportunity, please visit the Delta eSourcing portal at:
To respond to this opportunity, please click here:

REVIEW_PROCEDURE.P: The Authorities will incorporate a minimum 10 calendar day standstill period at the point information on the award of the contracts is communicated to tenderers. Applicants who are unsuccessful shall be informed by the relevant Authority as soon as possible after the decision has been made as to the reasons why the Applicant was unsuccessful. If an appeal regarding the award of the contract has not been successfully resolved, The Public Contracts Regulations 2015 (SI 2015 Nº. 102) provide for aggrieved parties who have been harmed or are at risk of harm by breach of the rules to take legal action. Any such action must be brought within the applicable limitation period. Where a contract has not been entered into, the Court may order the setting aside of the award decision or order the Authorities to amend any document and may award damages. If the contract has been entered into the Court may, depending on the circumstances, award damages, make a declaration of ineffectiveness, order the relevant Authority to pay a fine, and/or order that the duration of the contract be shortened. The purpose of the standstill period referred to above is to allow the parties to apply to the Courts to set aside the award decision before the contract is entered into.

ADDRESS_REVIEW_INFO.ADDRESS: St Martins House, 1 Lyric Square, London
